title: Waku: the Minimal React Framework Reaches Alpha
partialText: <img src="https://res.infoq.com/news/2026/02/waku-react-framework/en/headerimage/generatedHeaderImage-1770572559120.jpg"/><p>Waku 1.0 alpha, a lightweight React framework, achieves a major milestone with stable public APIs, shifting focus to bug fixes and compatibility. Ideal for mostly-static sites, it offers flexible rendering options. Built on Vite and Hono, Waku prioritizes developer experience, targeting small projects without the complexity of heavier frameworks like Next.js.</p> <i>By Daniel Curtis</i>

title: MUI Releases Base UI 1 with 35 Accessible Components
partialText: <img src="https://res.infoq.com/news/2026/02/baseui-v1-accessible/en/headerimage/generatedHeaderImage-1770233177777.jpg"/><p>Base UI 1.0 has officially launched! This unstyled React component library, backed by MUI, offers 35 accessible components with a commitment to long-term maintenance. With refined APIs and enhanced performance, it empowers developers to create custom designs effortlessly while ensuring robust accessibility out of the box.</p> <i>By Daniel Curtis</i>

title: Astro Announces Version 6 Beta with Redesigned Development Server and First-Class Cloudflare Workers
partialText: <img src="https://res.infoq.com/news/2026/02/astro-v6-beta-cloudflare/en/headerimage/generatedHeaderImage-1770127262626.jpg"/><p>Astro 6 Beta transforms web development with a revamped server leveraging Vite's Environment API, first-class Cloudflare Workers support, and stable live content collections. Emphasizing performance and security, it enables real-time data updates and strong Content Security Policy support. Designed for content-driven sites, Astro remains framework-agnostic amidst breaking changes.</p> <i>By Daniel Curtis</i>
